Description: Bronze lamp-stand or candelabrum stem fragments. Fragments of separately made fluted shaft, the top of which is broken away. The tenon of the shaft was brazed onto the foot in antiquity. Corroded; long cylindrical rod with convex flutings except at top and bottom; tapers towards the top.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Near complete parallel from Naukratis (Bailey Lamp Q3911; Bronze 1888,0601.5; GR1888,0601.5).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (KH.2)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
